project: H2 Hamiltonian Generation with PySCF - Basic Validation
description: A minimal test to verify Ralph can correctly use PySCF to generate the Hamiltonian for H2 molecule at 0.5 Å bond length. This serves as a foundational benchmark for quantum computational chemistry tasks.

objectives.description: Generate H2 molecule Hamiltonian at 0.5 Å bond length using PySCF and compute reference energies
acceptance_criteria: Python script that imports PySCF and creates H2 molecule at 0.5 Å bond length
Script performs Hartree-Fock calculation and extracts molecular integrals
Script computes Full Configuration Interaction (FCI) energy for reference
Script outputs Hamiltonian information (number of qubits, energy values)
Generate h2_results.json file with structured results in specified format
Run validation script to verify implementation against benchmark
Documentation explaining the molecular setup and results
Ralph learning log documenting iteration progress and thought process

output_requirements: Clear output showing Hamiltonian generation steps
Reproducible results (set random seeds if needed)
Ralph learning log showing iterative learning progress
computational_limits: Focus only on H2 molecule at 0.5 Å bond length
Keep computation light (PySCF HF+FCI for H2 is trivial)
This can run on login node as a quick test
verification_points: Expected H2 Hamiltonian dimension: 2-4 qubits depending on mapping
FCI energy should be close to literature values for H2 at 0.5 Å
Hamiltonian should be Hermitian and properly constructed

h2_results.json.notes: JSON file must be valid and include all required fields

validation_procedure.description: Implementation must be validated against benchmark values
steps: Check validation summary for any issues
If validation fails, review implementation and try again
validation_procedure.expected_outcome: All validation checks pass (validation_summary.txt shows PASS status)

technical: H2 molecule correctly defined with 0.5 Å bond length
process: Ralph completes the objective in one iteration
Knowledge about PySCF usage captured in AGENTS.md
Code is reusable for future quantum chemistry tasks
Ralph learning log demonstrates iterative learning and problem-solving
